metadata.title: CVE-2017-8854 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: wolfSSL before 3.10.2 has an out-of-bounds memory access with loading crafted DH parameters, aka a buffer overflow triggered by a malformed temporary DH file.

criterions.comment: wolfssl package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.10.2+dfsg-2').
